intro: Typhonium corrugatum, commonly known as the corrugated arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough, corrugated texture, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically hidden within the spathe. Typhonium corrugatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique appearance.
